text: Castanopsis foxworthyi is a tree in the family Fagaceae. It is named for the botanist Frederick William Foxworthy. ==Description== Castanopsis foxworthyi grows as a tree up to tall with a trunk diameter of up to . The smooth bark is blackish brown. The coriaceous leaves measure up to long. Its ovoid nuts measure up to long. ==Distribution and habitat== Castanopsis foxworthyi grows naturally in Peninsular Malaysia and Borneo. Its habitat is dipterocarp, peat swamp and kerangas forests from sea-level to altitude. ==References== foxworthyi Category:Trees of Peninsular Malaysia Category:Trees of Borneo Category:Plants described in 1913
title: Castanopsis foxworthyi
